page.title: 15Farms Around Leafield.
page.content: There are thirteen farms in this area. People farm wheat and barley and maize. At Potters Hill Farm they have a lot of sheep and cows.Lots of farmers like shooting game birds.At South Lawn they grow lots of crops and own a big wood.At Low Barrow they keep horses and only a small crop.At Church Farm they have a Jersey herd.At Lowbarrow there is a quarry.Lots of farms grow a border of different crops from what's inside the field. Langley Farm was once a hunting lodge for King John in the Wychwood Forest.Queen Elizabeth 1st stayed there.King John's Oak is nearby. Southlawn was once the home of the Mitford family. Lowbarrow has an old earthworks. Buttermilk Kennels are opposite Buttermilk Farm.
